c74object.name: sadam.rapidXML
c74object.description:
sadam.rapidXML
will create, read, store or even modify DOM trees. The DOM is one of the possible representations of the contents of an XML document (see http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Core/). The object internally uses the RapidXML 1.13 library (see http://rapidxml.sourceforge.net/), which is one of the fastest, yet still almost completely W3C compliant, freely available XML parsers.
When an XML is parsed, the object will assign a unique ID to each Element of the document, called the Element Index. This index won't get stored and changes each time when the order of Elements in the XML is modified (either by inserting or removing Elements). However, using the Element Index is the preferred (and in most cases, the only) way to address a given element in the XML. The Element Index is sent out the rightmost outlet each time an element is accessed. The Element Index of the Document Element is always 0, the rest of the Elements get their index in their 'order of appearence'. This means that even if an Element is being inserted or removed, the Index of the Elements that come earlier in the Document won't change.
When querying Attributes, Text, or CDATA nodes, the requested data will be sent out the appropriate outlets in right-to-left order (in case of Attributes, if more than one Attribute is requested, they will be sent to the output as a sequence like AttributeName1-AttributeValue1-AttributeName2-AttributeValue2-...-AttributeNameN-AttributeValueN, alternating on the appropriate outlets) followed by an error code. When querying Elements, the result will be sent out as a sequence (from right to left) consisting of the Element Index, the Tree Depth of the Element (the Document Element is at level 0, its children are at level 1 etc.), the Element's Tag Name, the Attributes, and finally the Text Content (which is a concatenation of all Text and CDATA nodes).
The leftmost outlet serves as an error outlet. After each command sent to the object, an error code is being sent back through this outlet at the end of the execution of the given command. A negative value means that the command could not be executed successfully, while 0 means success. In some cases (typically when one or more Elements are queried) the error outlet reports the number of Elements successfully returned.
As already mentioned, RapidXML 1.13 (and therefore sadam.rapidXML) is not fully W3C compliant. The main reason is that the parser ignores DOCTYPE declarations. There are also some difficulties with namespace management as well, the parser wouldn't refuse XMLs containing more than one root element and it will allow duplicate attributes for the same element. Also, to make parsing faster, all kind of XML validation is turned off by the wrapper Max object. If you need a 100% W3C compliant XML parser, consider sadam.dom, which is almost identical in functionality to sadam.rapidXML and requires MXJ to run.
This object was commissioned by Georg Hajdu for the MaxScore project. See http://www.computermusicnotation.com.

method.name: anything
method.description: The object will collect all incoming messages and concatenate them. When sending a bang, the object will try to parse the messages received since the previous bang as a single XML.

method.name: appendAttribute
method.description: Appends an Attribute to an Element.

method.name: appendCDATA
method.description: Appends a CDATA Section to the end of the text content of an Element.

method.name: appendChild
method.description: Appends a new Element to the end of the list of children of the given parent Element with the given tag name. Optionally, you can set a text value.

method.name: appendText
method.description: Appends additional text to the end of the text content of an Element.

method.name: bang
method.description: The object will collect all incoming messages and concatenate them. When sending a bang, the object will try to parse the messages received since the previous bang as a single XML.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clears the buffer that collects the incoming messages that could later be parsed.

method.name: createDocument
method.description: Creates a new Document where the Document Element will have the given name.

method.name: getAttribute
method.description: Sends out the value of the Attribute with the given name of the specified Element.

method.name: getChildNodes
method.description: Sends out all the child Elements of the given Element. If no Element Index is specified, it will output the children of the Document Element.

method.name: getChildNodesByTagName
method.description: Sends out all the child Elements of the given Element with the given name. If no Element Index is specified, it will output the children with the given name of the Document Element.

method.name: getElement
method.description: Sends out the Element with the given Index.

method.name: getElementsByTagName
method.description: Sends out all the Elements with a given name that belong to the tree fragment of the given Element. If no Element Index is specified, it will output all the Elements with the given name in the whole DOM tree.

method.name: getFirstChild
method.description: Sends out the first child of the given Element, if any. If no Index is present, it will send out the first child of the Document Element.

method.name: getLastChild
method.description: Sends out the last child of the given Element, if any. If no Index is present, it will send out the last child of the Document Element.

method.name: getNextSibling
method.description: Sends out the Element immediately following the given Element in the list of children of the parent node of the given Element.

method.name: getParentNode
method.description: Sends out the parent of the given Element.

method.name: getPreviousSibling
method.description: Sends out the Element immediately preceeding the given Element in the list of children of the parent node of the given Element.

method.name: getText
method.description: Sends out the text value of the given Element. If there are more text nodes associated with the given Element (like a mixture of CDATA and Text nodes), they will be concatenated into a single symbol.

method.name: getTree
method.description: Sends out all the Elements in the tree-fragment of the given Element. If no argument is specified, it sends out the whole DOM tree.

method.name: insertBefore
method.description: Inserts a new Element with the given name just before the given Element (so that the newly inserted element would have the given Index).

method.name: load
method.description: Parses the XML given as an argument.

method.name: parse
method.description: Fastest parser mode: parses the XML given as an argument 'on-the-fly' and sends it out immediately. The parsed XML won't be stored, therefore no Element Index will be assigned to the Elements. Parsing an XML using this method won't affect any internally stored data of the object, therefore you can use this method if you need to parse an XML only once and in the meantime you need to keep another XML in the memory (however, in these cases it is more convenient to use two separate instances of the object).

method.name: prependAttribute
method.description: Prepends an Attribute to an Element.

method.name: prependCDATA
method.description: Prepends a CDATA Section to the beginning of the text content of an Element.

method.name: prependChild
method.description: Prepends a new Element to the beginning of the list of children of the given parent Element with the given tag name. Optionally, you can set a text value.

method.name: prependText
method.description: Prepends additional text to the beginning of the text content of an Element.

method.name: print
method.description: Prints a tree fragment starting with the given Elements in the Max window. If no Index is given, it prints the full document.

method.name: read
method.description: Reads an XML into the object. If no filename is given, it lets the user select one.

method.name: readagain
method.description: Reloads the last read XML. If there was no XML read, it lets the user select one.

method.name: removeAttribute
method.description: Removes an Attribute with the given name from the specified Element.

method.name: removeAttributes
method.description: Removes all Attribute from the specified Element.

method.name: removeChildNodes
method.description: Removes all child Elements from the specified Element.

method.name: removeChildNodesByTagName
method.description: Removes all child Elements with the given name from the specified Element.

method.name: removeElement
method.description: Removes the specified Element from the DOM tree.

method.name: removeElementByTagName
method.description: Removes all Elements with the given name from the tree-fragment of the specified Element. If no parent Element is specified, it removes all Elements with the given name from the DOM tree.

method.name: removeText
method.description: Removes all text content (including CDATA sections, if any) from the specified Element.

method.name: serialize
method.description: Outputs the full Document in serialized form on the rightmost outlet as a single message.

method.name: setAttribute
method.description: Sets the value of the Attribute with the given name of the specified Element. If no Attribute exists with the given name, a new one is created.

method.name: setCDATA
method.description: Sets the text value of the given Element as a CDATA section. If a textual content (a text or a CDATA section) is already set, these are removed first.

method.name: setText
method.description: Sets the text value of the given Element. If a textual content (a text or a CDATA section) is already set, these are removed first.

method.name: write
method.description: Writes an XML to the disk. If no filename is given, it lets the user select one.

method.name: writeagain
method.description: Rewrites the last written XML to the disk. If there was no XML written, it lets the user select one.

attribute.name: redundant
attribute.digest: Output Element Index, Tree Depth and Element Name for each Attribute and Element Text Content.
attribute.description:
Enables (1) or disables (0) the reduntant state of the
sadam.dom
object. The default is 0 (disabled). When enabled, each Attribute (or Element Text Content) output will be preceeded by sending the Element Index, Tree Depth and Element Name values.

attribute.name: symbolOutput
attribute.description: When set to (1), all Element Text Content and Attribute Value fields will be sent out as single symbols. When set to (0), which is the default setting, the output will be a Max list.
